nodes.documentation:
@title Initializable
 * @dev Helper contract to support initializer functions. To use it, replace
the constructor with a function that has the `initializer` modifier.
WARNING: Unlike constructors, initializer functions must be manually
invoked. This applies both to deploying an Initializable contract, as well
as extending an Initializable contract via inheritance.
WARNING: When used with inheritance, manual care must be taken to not invoke
a parent initializer twice, or ensure that all initializers are idempotent,
because this is not dealt with automatically as with constructors.
nodes.name: Initializable

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Contract instance has already been initialized"

arguments.value: Contract instance has already been initialized

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Contract instance has already been initialized"

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier to use in the initializer function of a contract.
nodes.name: initializer

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns true if and only if the function is running in the constructor
nodes.name: isConstructor
